Definition.WordDefinition: Persuasive \Per*sua"sive\, a. [Cf. F. persuasif.] Tending to persuade; having the power of persuading; as, persuasive eloquence. ``Persuasive words.'' --Milton. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Persuasive \Per*sua"sive\, n. That which persuades; an inducement; an incitement; an exhortation. -- {Per*sua"sive*ly}, adv. -- {Per*sua"sive*ness}, n. [1913 Webster]

persuasive adj 1: tending or intended or having the power to induce action or belief; "persuasive eloquence"; "a most persuasive speaker" [ant: {dissuasive}] 2: capable of convincing; "a persuasive argument"; "the evidence is persuasive but not conclusive"
